title: Employment, labor productivity and environmental sustainability: Firm-level evidence from transition. (arXiv:2310.18989v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: This paper examines how investment in environmentally sustainable practices impacts employment and labor productivity growth of firms in transition economies. The study considers labor skill composition and geographical differences, shedding light on sustainability dynamics. The empirical analysis relies on the World Bank-s Enterprise Survey 2019 for 24 transition economies, constructing an environmental sustainability index from various indicators through a Principal Components Analysis. To address endogeneity, a battery of fixed effects and instrumental variables are employed. Results reveal the relevance of environmental sustainability for both employment and labor productivity growth. However, the significance diminishes when addressing endogeneity comprehensively, alluding that any relation between environmentally sustainable practices and jobs growth is more complex and needs time to work. translated_title: 就业、劳动生产率和环境可持续性：转型中的企业层面证据
translated_abstract: 本文研究了在转型经济中，对环境可持续性实践的投资如何影响企业的就业和劳动生产率增长。研究考虑了劳动力技能组成和地理差异，揭示了可持续性动态。实证分析基于世界银行2019年的企业调查数据，通过主成分分析构建了一个环境可持续性指数。为了解决内生性问题，采用了一系列固定效应和工具变量。结果显示，环境可持续性对就业和劳动生产率的增长都具有重要意义。然而，在全面解决内生性问题时，这种关系的显著性减弱，暗示环境可持续性实践与就业增长之间的任何关系更加复杂，需要时间来发挥作用。
tldr: 研究发现，在转型经济中，对环境可持续性实践的投资对就业和劳动生产率增长具有重要影响，但在解决内生性问题时，这种影响逐渐减弱，暗示两者之间的关系更加复杂，需要时间来发挥作用。
en_tdlr: This study provides firm-level evidence that investment in environmentally sustainable practices has a significant impact on employment and labor productivity growth in transition economies. However, the significance diminishes when addressing endogeneity comprehensively, suggesting a complex relationship that requires time to work.
